channel.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
channel.description: Hey, I was wondering if this this is worth getting. I already made enough money to get it. I really like corvettes, but I don't have that much money to get the newer models. http://sfbay.craigslist.org/sby/cto/2899914617.html

item.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Dharma, post:16, topic:436838”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=539552.msg3953514#msg3953514 date=1332521899]

Look up the value on kbb.com and nada.com to see if it is a good deal. Also, at least around here with salt on the roads, those are prone to the frame rails rusting out in the rear, so check for that. Also, if you are going to spend that much, it would be worth paying $100 for a mechanic to check it out first, if they don’t agree to that, then you don’t want the car.

If you like that body style and car, it’s a pretty sweet and fast car that should be fairly cheap and easy to work on if you do the work yourself. What kind of racing did you plan on doing?

My friends and I find people and we just race around our neighborhood. I think it would be called corner racing I think? I don’t think I’m going to get that car anymore. Plus my dad is working 7 days a week and I don’t want to bother him. Plus I don’t know that much about cars and don’t have time to learn because of sports. School and my job. I plan to save up and buy this: http://sfbay.craigslist.org/sby/cto/2903577744.html

There are multiple things wrong with that, which Greeny and TheBeanie have covered a bit. But also, that corvette is a MUCH better deal then that mustang, which is a rip-off, and the corvette is a MUCH better ‘race car’ than the mustang in every conceivable way except maybe in a perfectly straight line. It has much better brakes, better suspension, is lighter, and actually has a better engine too. If you spend the $7500 on the corvette, and then spend the difference from the price of the mustang ($2500) building up the corvette engine some more, you would have a much nicer and insanely faster car than the mustang ever could be.

Also, street racing is stupid, around here you can go to the drag strip on friday nights and pay $5 to race your car down it all you want. I’m sure there are similar things around where you live, call around, or look on the internet.
[/quote]
Alright I’ll get the corvette then. How would I go on to modify the car? Would supercharging the car be a good idea?[/quote]
Drive it first and see if it NEEDS to be modified, my bet is it’s probably already too much car for you to handle right now. But yes, a supercharger or turbocharger would do wonders for that car, though it might not be something you can do yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Buy corvette, swap LS1 in it.

Read full topic

item.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Haha, my advice would be to get someone that knows what they are doing to fit the supercharger, there is a car garage down the road thats just taken a car in that the turbo jammed (or somethin) and it blew the engine up.

Read full topic

item.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I assume that illegal, why not pay a small fee and go have some real fun on a proper track?

Sure it costs but if you kill someone then you’re spending a fair chunk of your life behind bars. Street racing is as bad as drink driving to me, simply because if you’re racing you don’t really have safety of others on your mind.

Read full topic

item.title: 1989 Corvette 6 speed Z51
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:6, topic:436838”][quote author=Dharma link=topic=539552.msg3949602#msg3949602 date=1332188568]

Slow

Yeah. I talked to the owner and he said the top speed is a little bit more than 140 MPH
[/quote]

Yeah so is the top speed on my bicycle but how long does it take to get there?[/quote]

Owner doesn’t know. -.- What I’m looking for is a car I can race with. I had a Chevy Corvette Z06, but I sold it because my family was running low on money. I tried to build a car from scrap with my dad, but now he doesn’t have anytime because he’s working a lot. So I sold that on craiglist. So basically I want a somewhat cheap car I can race with.

Read full topic
